For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. # Hut 8 Corp (NASDAQ: HUT) - Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Report Date:** October 11, 2024  
**Current Stock Price:** $13.08 (Yahoo Finance, as of market close Oct 11, 2024)  
**Market Capitalization:** $1.35 billion (Yahoo Finance, as of Oct 11, 2024)  
**52-Week Range:** $6.77 - $21.42  
**Avg. Daily Volume (3-mo):** 11.2 million shares  

## Company Overview
Hut 8 Corp is a leading North American digital infrastructure company specializing in Bitcoin mining, high-performance computing (HPC), and energy infrastructure solutions. Originally focused on self-mining Bitcoin using proprietary and hosted infrastructure, Hut 8 has evolved into a diversified operator following its November 2023 business combination with US Bitcoin Corp (completed January 2024), which expanded its footprint to 10 data centers across North America with a self-mining capacity of approximately 9.3 EH/s as of Q2 2024. The company now emphasizes three pillars: (1) Bitcoin mining and hosting services for third parties, (2) managed infrastructure for HPC and AI workloads via its Highrise AI and American Bitcoin subsidiaries, and (3) power-optimized energy strategies including curtailment and co-location deals. Hut 8 holds ~10,264 BTC on its balance sheet (as of Q2 2024 earnings, Aug 13, 2024). With a focus on low-cost, renewable-heavy power (e.g., hydro in Quebec, nuclear-adjacent sites), Hut 8 differentiates through vertical integration, owning sites in Texas, New York, and Canada. Recent strategic shifts position it beyond pure-play mining into AI/HPC amid surging data center demand, targeting 31 EH/s self-mining hashrate by end-2025. (198 words)

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Aug 13, 2024):** Revenue $21.8M (up 19% QoQ from $18.3M); net loss $134.3M primarily from $97.6M non-cash impairment on mining assets; gross margin -1% (adjusted EBITDA -$4.5M); self-mined 234 BTC; deployed hashrate 9.3 EH/s (Yahoo Finance, SEC 10-Q).
- **September 30, 2024:** Announced $150M convertible note financing with Macquarie Asset Management to fund ASIC miner purchases and expansion (company press release).
- **September 25, 2024:** Partnered with BITMAIN for up to 15 EH/s of latest S21+ miners (94 J/TH efficiency), deliveries starting Q4 2024 through 2025 (Hut 8 investor relations).
- **July 2024:** Completed hosting migration at Hosting Valleyfield site (Quebec), boosting efficiency; self-mined 373 BTC in July alone (monthly update).
- **June 2024:** Launched Highrise AI platform for GPU colocation targeting AI firms (company announcement).
- **Stock Surge:** +150% YTD as of Oct 11, 2024, driven by Bitcoin rally above $60K and AI pivot hype (CoinDesk, Seeking Alpha discussions).

## Growth Strategy
- Expand self-mining hashrate from 9.3 EH/s to 31 EH/s by end-2025 via miner deployments and site optimizations (Q2 earnings call).
- Diversify into HPC/AI: Convert 215 MW capacity for GPU hosting; target $100M+ annual revenue from non-mining by 2026 (management guidance, Sept 2024 investor day).
- Energy optimization: Secure 1.1 GW power pipeline, emphasizing renewables (60%+ hydro/nuclear); pursue power curtailment deals for revenue upside.
- Bitcoin accumulation: HODL strategy, holding 10K+ BTC; opportunistic selling only for capex.
- M&A focus: Bolt-on acquisitions for sites/power (e.g., post-US Bitcoin integration).

## Headwinds and Tailwinds
| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Strong BTC holdings ($650M+ at $63K/BTC); efficient fleet post-halving (avg. 25 J/TH); AI pivot amid NVDA-led data center boom. | Q2 impairments signal asset writedowns; high debt post-financings ($150M notes); operational delays in miner installs (Q2 call). |
| **Sector-Wide (Bitcoin Mining)** | BTC price >$60K (post-halving recovery); global hashrate growth favors efficient miners; AI/HPC demand (CAGR 30%+ to 2030, McKinsey). | Post-halving revenue drop (rewards halved Apr 2024); energy costs up 10-20% in key regions; US regulations (e.g., potential energy taxes, Oct 2024 FERC proposals); China dominance (55% global hashrate). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Self-Mining:** Operates 9.3 EH/s across 10 sites (e.g., Alpha, Bravo in Texas; Drumheller, Alberta).
- **Hosting:** 3.2 EH/s hosted for clients; full lifecycle management (power, cooling).
- **HPC/AI Infrastructure:** Highrise AI offers GPU colocation (115 MW available).
- **Energy Solutions:** Power management, including Virtual Power Plant (VPP) for grid services.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **BITMAIN S21+ Deployment:** 15 EH/s rollout Q4 2024-Q2 2025, targeting 31 EH/s total.
- **American Bitcoin Subsidiary:** New self-mining entity with 10 EH/s pipeline (launched post-merger).
- **Granite Site (Texas):** 200 MW expansion for HPC/AI GPUs, online H2 2025.
- **AI Data Centers:** 500 MW+ GPU hosting pipeline via Highrise AI partnerships (Sept 2024 update).

## Market Share
- **Bitcoin Mining:** ~2.5% of global hashrate (9.3 EH/s / ~380 EH/s network total, CoinWarz Oct 11, 2024).
- **North American Hosting:** ~5-7% (est. from 3.2 EH/s hosted vs. regional 60 EH/s, Cambridge Centre for Alternative Finance).
- **HPC/AI Hosting:** Emerging <1% (nascent market, but 215 MW positions for 2-3% US share by 2026 per mgmt).

**Forecast:** Mining share stable-to-up 4% by 2026 on expansions (vs. peers); HPC/AI share to 3-5% via GPU ramp-up, driven by 50% CAGR in data centers (IDC).

## Competitor Comparison
| Metric (as of Q2 2024) | HUT | MARA | RIOT | CLSK | CIFR |
|------------------------|-----|------|------|------|------|
| **Hashrate (EH/s)**   | 9.3 | 31.5 | 19.5 | 9.6  | 7.0  |
| **BTC Holdings**      | 10,264 | 20,000+ | 8,500 | 500+ | 1,000+ |
| **Rev (Q2, $M)**      | 21.8 | 138  | 71   | 50   | 28   |
| **Mkt Cap ($B)**      | 1.35 | 5.8  | 3.2  | 2.8  | 1.4  |
| **EV/Hashrate ($/EH)**| ~145K | ~185K | ~164K | ~292K | ~200K |
| **Key Edge**          | AI diversification, low-cost power | Scale, BTC yield | Energy innovation | Retail investor base | Pure-play efficiency |

HUT trades at discount to peers on EV/hashrate, but lags scale; AI pivot could close gap (Seeking Alpha Oct 2024 analyses).

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships:** BITMAIN (miners, Sept 2024); Core Scientific (potential hosting overflow); Nvidia ecosystem for AI GPUs (implied via Highrise).
- **M&A:** US Bitcoin merger (Jan 2024, $140M value); acquired Seven Mile Creek site (Q1 2024).
- **Current Clients:** Hosted miners (unnamed, ~20% revenue); early AI firms via Highrise (e.g., ML startups).
- **Potential Major Clients:** Hyperscalers (MSFT, GOOG) for AI colocation; energy firms for VPP (e.g., ERCOT grid in Texas).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **Management:** CEO Asher Genoot (post-merger) praised for execution; board adds AI expertise (e.g., ex-Core Scientific).
- **ESG:** 70% renewable power; low water usage; transparent sustainability reports.
- **Risks:** BTC volatility (beta 3.5); dilution from converts; regulatory (e.g., NY Bitcoin mining moratorium extensions).
- **Sentiment:** Bullish on X/Reddit (r/BitcoinMining, Oct 2024: AI pivot "game-changer"); analyst consensus "Buy" (avg target $16.50, TipRanks).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating:** 8/10 (Strong Buy for growth portfolios) – High upside from BTC rally, hashrate expansion, AI diversification; moderate risk via power assets offsetting halving pressures.
- **Estimated Fair Value:** $22.00 (69% upside from $13.08) – DCF-based (20x 2026E EBITDA $150M est., incorporating 31 EH/s at $40K/BTC, 20% HPC rev); aligns with high-end analyst targets (Benchmark $20, HC Wainwright $18, as of Oct 2024). Hold for dips below $12; suitable for 20-30% portfolio growth allocation.
